alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 16 at 9:41PM MST until January 18 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations 8 to 12 inches in the valleys and 14 to 21 inches in the mountains. * WHERE...Kellogg, Wallace, St. Maries, Lookout Pass, Fourth Of July Pass, Fernwood, Osburn, Pinehurst, Dobson Pass, and Mullan. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 7 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Wednesday morning and evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates of 1 inch per hour is expected during the Wednesday evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road information in Idaho, call 5 1 1.
